text.promptTutorialEnter: If you'd like an introduction to the game's rules, you can try the tutorial puzzles.
text.promptTutorialNext: You've completed this step of the tutorial. Move on to the next step for more tips.
text.promptTutorialLeave: You've completed the tutorial puzzles. If you'd like more challenging puzzles to solve, you can play the latest puzzles.

puzzle.title: Tutorial Part 1
puzzle.description:
Fill in squares by pressing down on an empty square, and dragging to another empty square in the same row.

Each square will be filled with the header letter of the other square.

puzzle.title: Tutorial Part 2
puzzle.description:
When you have multiple options for how to fill in a square, you can use logical rules to deduce how to fill it in.

The main rule of the puzzle is: each letter may only appear once in each column.

You can use this fact to figure out how to fill in the squares below.

If you fill in a square incorrectly, you can switch to "Erase" and press the square to clear it.

puzzle.title: Tutorial Part 3
puzzle.description:
There are a number of logical rules you can use. For example:

  • If there are only two squares left in a row, they must be connected.
  • If there is only one empty square in a column, connect it to the letter missing from that column.
  • If a column is missing a letter and can only connect to that letter in a single row, connect it to that letter in that row.

Try to apply these three rules to fill in the grid below.

These rules are all derived from the main rule that a letter may not appear more than once in a single column. You may discover even more types of logical rules as you solve more advanced puzzles.
